intro: Rhododendron titapuriense, commonly known as the Titapuri rhododendron, is a species native to the Himalayas, specifically found in Nepal and India. It is a deciduous shrub that typically grows at high altitudes, often in moist, shaded environments. The plant features dense, leathery leaves and produces clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It belongs to the Ericaceae family and is valued for its ornamental qualities in horticulture. Due to its limited distribution, it is also considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
